title: 游戏启动之后提示错误
author: 小七4466
txt_content:
[17:50:50] [AWT-EventQueue-0/INFO] Start generating launching command...
[17:50:50] [Game Launcher/INFO] Building process
[17:50:50] [Game Launcher/INFO] Logging in...
[17:50:51] [Game Launcher/INFO] Detecting libraries...
[17:50:51] [Game Launcher/INFO] Unpacking natives...
[17:50:59] [Game Launcher/INFO] *** Make shell command ***
[17:50:59] [Game Launcher/INFO] On making head command.
[17:50:59] [Game Launcher/INFO] Java Version: 1.8.0_151
[17:50:59] [Game Launcher/INFO] Java Platform: 32
[17:50:59] [Game Launcher/INFO] System Platform: 64
[17:51:04] [Game Launcher/INFO] System Physical Memory: 3822
[17:51:04] [Game Launcher/ERROR] 
---- Hello Minecraft! Crash Report ----
  Version: 2.4.1.6
  Time: 2017-12-24 17:51:04
  Thread: Thread[Game Launcher,6,main]

  Content: 
    java.lang.ClassCastException: java.base/jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader cannot be cast to java.base/java.net.URLClassLoader

    at org.jackhuang.hellominecraft.util.Utils.getURLString(Utils.java:56)

    at org.jackhuang.hellominecraft.launcher.core.launch.AbstractMinecraftLoader.makeHeadCommand(AbstractMinecraftLoader.java:133)

    at org.jackhuang.hellominecraft.launcher.core.launch.AbstractMinecraftLoader.makeLaunchingCommand(AbstractMinecraftLoader.java:144)

    at org.jackhuang.hellominecraft.launcher.core.launch.GameLauncher.makeLaunchCommand(GameLauncher.java:110)

    at org.jackhuang.hellominecraft.launcher.util.HMCLGameLauncher$1.run(HMCLGameLauncher.java:88)



-- System Details --
  Operating System: Windows 7 (amd64), 6.1
  Java Version: 9.0.1, Oracle Corporation
  Java VM Version: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (mixed mode), Oracle Corporation
在我启动游戏的时候出现的，在这段文字之前还出现了一个提示我要用64位java的文字，在那段文字之后就出现了上面这段文字这是为什么。

replies.author: 小七4466
replies.txt_content:
如果是需要我更换java的话。
我就没什么问题了

replies.author: 小七4466
replies.txt_content: 我试了下用了64位也是这样。唉

replies.author: 小七4466
replies.txt_content:
Dnrshunt_CST 发表于 2017-12-24 17:55
你试试最新版的java
我发现我用的64位不是java8的  我换上java8的 就好了。。。。
